channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: iPhone sales slump in China as Apple falters in key market
item.description: The company's overall sales in China declined 11.1% during the quarter to $18.51 billion.

item.title: Joni Mitchell, Billie Eilish and Others Perform at FireAid Concert
item.description: Katy Perry belted out “California Gurls,” and Joni Mitchell offered a rare performance as Angelenos spoke movingly about loss — and resilience.

item.description: Since Islamist rebels overthrew the Assad dictatorship in Syria, Egypt, with parallels in its own recent history, has watched warily.

item.title: Plane Crash Clues, and a New Way to Treat Pain
Meta said it would fire staff who leaked company intel. Then that memo got leaked
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg bemoaned the fact his meetings and memos kept being leaked to the press, so Meta pledged to buckle down on staff.
